qas.question: The four species of grouse found in BC are:
answers: Spruce Grouse, Blue Grouse, Ruffed Grouse, Sharp-tailed Grouse
Spruce Grouse, Fir Grouse, Cedar Grouse, Pine Grouse
Willow Grouse, Blue Grouse, Ruffed Grouse, Sharp-tailed Grouse
Rock Grouse, Gray Grouse, California Grouse, Chukar

qas.question: Spruce Grouse are found mainly in high-elevation conifer forests:
Male Blue Grouse
answers: Have a yellow comb over the eye
Are found in fields and parkland until mating season
Make crowing sounds like a rooster

qas.question: Spruce Grouse
answers: Have a gray back, head, neck and shoulders, with black bars
Nest in lower elevations and otherwise live at higher elevations
Fly far and fast when flushed
Are endangered in BC and cannot be hunted

qas.question: To hunt ducks or geese, you need a:
Ptarmigan, grouse, pheasants, partridges, chuckar, quail and turkey are all:
Canada, snow, Ross', white-fronted, black-brant are all:
Sea ducks are:
answers: Not actually found near the ocean
